title: Troye Sivan is still figuring out who he is: 'There are no rules'
text:
Troye is taking his time (Picture: Imagespace via ZUMA Wire)

After spending 15 years wishing he wasn’t gay, Troye Sivan is still figuring out his identity.

The 24-year-old was ‘terrified’ of who he was and is still taking the time to figure things out.

Speaking with Harper’s Bazaar Australia Man, the singer said: ‘Coming out as gay is one thing. And then coming out as the person you want to be is a whole other separate journey.

‘Growing up in a society where I didn’t want to be gay for the first 15 years of my life, I was terrified of it.

‘That’s still in there and I’m personally trying to work it out. I’m enjoying this process of pushing myself, figuring out – am I into this? Am I not? There are no rules.’

Troye revealed to the world that he was gay on his YouTube channel in 2013 and he quickly became a ‘gay icon’ in the community.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘With people like Hayley Kiyoko and Brockhampton, we’re starting to get, finally, a diverse group of different LGBTQ perspectives,’ the Happy Pills singer previously told Another Man magazine.

He firmly believes ‘gay icon’ roles should be more diverse (Picture: Troye Sivan/YouTube)

‘That’s why I politely don’t want to take on that “gay icon” thing. I’m one voice of so many that are missing, and so I’m just trying to tell my story.’

The Lucky Strike singer has been open about his experiences as a gay teen and wants to continue talking about it as long as there still ‘hunger’ for the conversation.

Troye said: ‘As long as people are asking about it, it means there’s still hunger for that conversation. I’m in a pretty privileged place. I live in West Hollywood, where everyone is gay, and I’ve got supportive family and friends.

‘For me to be sick of talking about a subject that for other people is still so real and has an impact on their daily lives … I kind of think it’s the least I can do.’

The songwriter is on the last leg of his touring, finishing off Bloom the Tour in China.

description: Singer Troye Sivan is still figuring out who he really is after spending most of his life not wanting to be gay.
